metadata.Title: CVE-2017-8934 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
PCManFM 1.2.5 insecurely uses /tmp for a socket file, allowing a local user to cause a denial of service (application unavailability).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8934` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

pcmanfm - 1.2.0-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pcmanfm package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.0-1ubuntu0.1').
